org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.regalloc.ia32

Class RegisterRestrictions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.regalloc.GenericRegisterRestrictions
      • org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.regalloc.ia32.RegisterRestrictions

  • public final class RegisterRestrictions
extends GenericRegisterRestrictions
    An instance of this class encapsulates restrictions on register assignment.

        Add architecture-specific register restrictions for a basic block. Override as needed.
        Overrides:
        addArchRestrictions in class GenericRegisterRestrictions
        Parameters:
        bb - the basic block
        symbolics - the live intervals for symbolic registers on this block

      • has8BitMemoryOperand

        boolean has8BitMemoryOperand(Instruction s)
        Parameters:
        s - the instruction to check
        Returns:
        true if and only if the instruction contains an 8-bit memory operand

      • handle8BitRestrictions

        void handle8BitRestrictions(Instruction s)
        Ensure that if an operand has an 8 bit memory operand that all of its register operands are in 8 bit registers.
        Parameters:
        s - the instruction to restrict

      • restrictTo8Bits

        void restrictTo8Bits(Register r)
        Ensures that a particular register is only assigned to AL, BL, CL, or DL, since these are the only 8-bit registers we normally address.
        Parameters:
        r - the register that needs to be restricted to 8 bits

      • mustBeInRegister

        public static boolean mustBeInRegister(Register r,
                                       Instruction s)
        Given symbolic register r that appears in instruction s, does the architecture demand that r be assigned to a physical register in s?
        Parameters:
        r - a symbolic register
        s - instruction where the register appears
        Returns:
        true if the symbolic register r must use a physical register in the instruction, false if we can use a spill location

      • okFor8

        private boolean okFor8(Register r)
        Parameters:
        r - the register to check
        Returns:
        true if the physical register r hold an 8-bit value?

      • isForbidden

        public boolean isForbidden(Register symb,
                           Register r,
                           Instruction s)
        Description copied from class: GenericRegisterRestrictions
        Is it forbidden to assign symbolic register symb to physical register r in instruction s?
        Specified by:
        isForbidden in class GenericRegisterRestrictions
        Parameters:
        symb - a symbolic register
        r - a physical register
        s - the instruction that's the scope for the check
        Returns:
        true if it's forbidden, false otherwise
